turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: I'm willin, to go on a little faith, here.

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: You will not believe it.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Try me.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Okay, let's cut to the chase. He's afraid of cats, what's that about?

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: According to the ancients, cat's are the guardians at the gates of the underworld. Imhotep will fear them until he is fully regenerated, and then he will fear nothing.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: So your sayin', if we find the book made outta gold --

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: -- And read the sacred incantations contained inside it.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: You think it'll send this guy back to hell?

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Correct, And that's when --

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: Which would be located not far to the east of the Anubis statue.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Don't tell me we gotta go back out there?

turns.speaker: CURATOR
turns.text: If we want to kill the creature, yes.

turns.speaker: DANIELS
turns.text: See! That proves it! Old Seti's fortune's gotta be under this sand!

turns.speaker: HENDERSON
turns.text: For them to protect it like this, you just know there's got to be treasure down there.

turns.speaker: HENDERSON
turns.text: I wouldn't trade ya for a brass spittoon!

turns.speaker: DANIELS
turns.text: Yeah! It's supposed to be made outta pure gold!

turns.speaker: HENDERSON
turns.text: The sun turning black.

turns.speaker: DANIELS
turns.text: Water turning to blood.

turns.speaker: DANIELS
turns.text: You bastards!

turns.speaker: HENDERSON
turns.text: What did you do to him!?

turns.speaker: HENDERSON
turns.text: The hell with that! I'm not goin' nowhere! We're safe here.

turns.speaker: DANIELS
turns.text: Yeah, I'm not leavin, this fort for nothin'.

turns.speaker: DANIELS
turns.text: The hell with this. I'm goin, downstairs to get me a drink. You want somethin'?

turns.speaker: HENDERSON
turns.text: Yeah, get me a glass of bourbon, a shot of bourbon and a bourbon chaser.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: And what is he in prison for?

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: I did not know, so when I heard you were coming, I asked him that myself.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: And what did he say?

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: He said... he was just looking for a good time.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Where are they taking him?

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: To be hanged.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: No women allowed.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I am an English woman.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I will give you one hundred pounds to spare his life.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: I would pay one hundred pounds just to see him hang.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Two hundred pounds.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Proceed!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Three hundred pounds!

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: You lie.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I would never!

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Are you saying this filthy godless son of a pig knows where to find The City Of The Dead? Truly?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes and if you cut him down, we will give you ten percent.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Fifty percent.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Twenty.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Forty.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: A bright good morning to all.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: I have come to protect my investment, thank you very much.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Do you realize, we are standing inside a room that no one has entered in over four thousand years.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Who cares? I don't see no treasure.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: So who's the broad?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Broad?!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: We uh,... found... your puzzle box, and we've come to ask you about it.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: No... You came to ask me about Hamunaptra.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How do you know the box pertains to Hamunaptra?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Because that's where I found it. I was there.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You were actually at Hamunaptra?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: I just decked your brother

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, well...  I know my brother.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Yeah, I was there.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You swear?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Every damn day.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No, I mean --

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: -- I know what you mean. I was there, alright. Seti's place. The City Of The Dead.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What did you find? What did you see?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: I found sand. I saw death.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Could you tell me how to get there? The exact location?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Want to know?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Really want to know?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Give... give him... give him GLAAAA-- !

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Twenty-five percent, and not one single farthing more.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Sorry, didn't mean to scare ya.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: The only thing that scares me, Mister O'Connell, are your manners.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Still angry that I kissed ya, huh?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: If you call that a kiss.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Did I miss something? Are we going into battle?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: The last time I was at that place everybody I was with died.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: There's something out there, you know, something under that sand.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, I'm hoping to find a certain artifact, a book, actually, my brother thinks there's treasure. What do you think is out there?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Evil. The Tuaregs and the Bedouin believe that Hamunaptra is cursed, they call it, "the doorway to hell."

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Ahmar is Ossirion. "Passageway to the underworld", actually.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I don't believe in fairy tales and hokum, Mister O'Connell, but I do believe that one of the most famous books in history is buried out there, The Book Of The Living. It's what first interested me in Egypt as a child. It's why I came here, sort of a life's pursuit.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: And the fact that they say it's made out of pure gold, makes no nevermind to you, right?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You know your history.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: I know my treasure.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Relax! I'm the map!  It's all up here.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh that's comforting.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Can you swim?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well of course I can swim, if the occasion calls for it.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Trust me.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: We're almost there.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: We're about to be shown the way.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: That "thing" gets me excited.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: The things that get you excited.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: According to Bembridge Scholars, inside the statue of Anubis was a secret compartment, perhaps containing The Book Of The Living.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: What are those mirrors for?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Ancient Egyptian trick. You'll see.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh my god, It's a preparation room.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Preparation for what?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: For entering the afterlife.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Yeah, that'd bring you back to life.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You two are worse than a couple of schoolboys.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh my god,... it looks like, it looks like a sarcophagus.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Why would they bury somebody in the ceiling?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: They didn't, they buried him at the foot of Anubis. He was either someone of great importance. Or he did something very naughty.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: There's some sort of lock here. You say these thing's are made of granite with a steel interior?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Quarried granite with a cobalt lining.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: A key! That's it! That's what he was talking about.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Who was talking about what?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Seems the Americans had a little misadventure of their own today, three of their diggers were killed.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Salt acid. Pressurized salt acid. Some sort of ancient booby-trap.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You two!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: You don't believe in curses, huh?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No. I believe if I can see it and I can touch it, then it's real. That's what I believe.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Unlike your brother, Miss, you I don't get. You're a whole new brew.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I know, you're wondering, what's a place like me doing in a girl like this?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Egypt is in my blood. My father was a famous explorer, he loved Egypt so much that he married an Egyptian. My mother! Who was quite an adventurer herself

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Okay, I get your father, I get your mother and I get your brother, but what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I may not be an explorer, or an adventurer, or a treasure hunter, or a gunfighter! Mister O'Connell But I'm proud of what I am.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: And what is that?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm going to kiss you, Mister O'Connell.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: No you're not.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm not?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Not unless you call me Rick.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Why would I do that?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Because that's my name.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No... Why?... Should I?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Gee, yeah, you told me it was the best time you ever had.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh my god, I've dreamed about this ever since I was a little girl.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: You dream about dead guys?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Is he supposed to look like that?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No. I've never seen a mummy look like this. He's, he's still...

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Are you saying somebody threw these things in with our guy, and they slowly ate him alive?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Very slowly.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: According to my readings, our friend suffered the HOM-DAI, the worst of all ancient Egyptian curses, one reserved for only the most evil blasphemers. In all of my research, I've never read of this curse actually having been performed.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: That bad huh?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, they never used it because they feared it so. It's written, that if a victim of the HOM-DAI should ever arise, he would bring with him the ten plagues of Egypt.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: The ten plagues?... You mean all ten plagues.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: You sure you outta be playin, around with that?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's just a book, no harm ever came from a book.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Having an encounter with a four thousand year old walking-talking corpse tends to convert one.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Forget it, we're out the door down the hall and gone.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No, we are not.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No we are not. We woke him up, and we must try and stop him.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: We?! What we?! You didn't read that book. I told you not to play around with that thing.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Alright then, Me, I,... I read the book, I woke him up and I intend to stop him.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Then we'll have to find some immortal ones.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: There goes that belief again. Not me, I am outta here!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: According to that Book, once this creature has been reborn, his curse will spread, and as he grows in strength, so will his curse grow, infecting the people until the whole of the earth is destroyed.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Yeah? So? Is that my problem?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's everybody's problem!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Look lady, I appreciate you saving my life and all, but when I signed on, I agreed to take you out there and bring you back, and I did, now were even, end of job, end of story, contract terminated.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: That's what I am to you? A contract?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: You can either tag along with me, or you can stay here and play around with Mister Maggot.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm staying.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: FINE.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: He's here! I saw him! That thing is here!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: The creature!? Are you sure!?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You called me your girl?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: What?... Oh yeah, that was just um, you know, figure a speech.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I think you were jealous

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Jealous? You kiddin' me? Did you see that guy's face?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Got it!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Got what?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Don't do it, Evelyn.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I have no choice.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Got guts, lady.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, I know, and I'd like to keep them.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You...! YOU...!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Drunkard? Fool? Rat-bastard? Please call me something original.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Have you no respect for the dead?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Right now, I only wish to join them.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well I wish you'd do it sooner rather than later, before you ruin my career the way you've ruined yours.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: My dear, sweet, baby sister, I'll have you know, that at this moment my career is on a high note.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Oh yes I do! I have something right here!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh no, not another worthless trinket, Jonathan, if I bring one more piece of junk to the Curator to try and sell for you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Jonathan?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I think you found something.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Two questions. Who the hell is Seti the First? And was he rich?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He was the last Pharaoh of the Old Kingdom, said to be the wealthiest Pharaoh of them all.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Alright, good, that's good. I like this fellow, like him very much.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes. The City of The Dead. Where the early Pharaohs were said to have hidden the wealth of Egypt.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Right, right, in a big underground treasure chamber. Everybody knows the story. The entire necropolis was rigged to sink into the sand. On Pharaoh's command, a flick of the switch! And the whole place could disappear beneath the dunes.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: All we know is that the city mysteriously vanished around 2,134 B.C.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You told me you found it on a dig down in Thebes!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: I was mistaken.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You lied to me!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: I lie to everybody, what makes you so special?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm your sister.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: That just makes you more gullible.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You stole it from a drunk at the local Casbah?!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Picked his pocket, actually.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: But he's just a filthy criminal?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Way to go, Evy.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Do you really think he'll show up?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Undoubtedly, I know the breed, he may be a cowboy, but his word is his word.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Personally, I think he's filthy, rude and a complete scoundrel. I don't like him one bit.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Ah, begging your pardon, but shouldn't we be going?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: After all, you rode us night and day to win that bet.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: According to my calculations, we should be right under the statue. We'll come up right between his legs.  Oh my.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: And when those dirty Yanks go to sleep --  No offense.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's called mummification. You're dead when they do this

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Still...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What do you suppose killed him?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Did you ever see him eat?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I can't believe I allowed the two of you to get me drunk.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Don't blame me, I don't even remember being there.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well neither do I, thank you.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Juicy?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes. He's more than four thousand years old and still decomposing.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: I found it, Evy! I found it

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Shut-up and get me off of here!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: What do I do, Evy!? What do I do!?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Read the inscription on the cover!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Finish the inscription, idiot!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Ummm, Hootash im... Hootash im now what is this last symbol here?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What's it look like!?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Ah! Ah! Ahmenophus!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Yes,... I see.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: She's my sister, actually.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Yeah? Well,... I'm sure she's not a total loss.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Hey,... don't I know you?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Um, well, you see...

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Sit down, O'Connell, sit down, we could use another good player.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: I only gamble with my life, never my money.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: I can't believe the price of these fleabags.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: We coulda had 'em for free, all we had to do was give 'em your sister.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Yes, awfully tempting, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Awfully.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: That thing gives me the creeps.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Be nice. That thing saved my life.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: You're welcome to my share of the spider webs.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: And it stinks to high heaven in here.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: None taken.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: We'll sneak up and steal that book right out from under them.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: And you're sure you can find the secret compartment?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Lemme get this straight, they stuck a sharp, red hot poker up your nose, cut your brain into small pieces, then ripped it all out through your nostrils?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: OWCH! That's really got to hurt.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Whoever's in here, sure wasn't getting out.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: No kiddin', without a key, it'll take us a month to crack this thing,

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Tough break.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Yes, I'm all tears, now let's see who's inside, shall we?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Where's my gun?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: What are you going to do? Shoot him?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: If he decides to wake up, hell yes!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: You did not!?... We're not!?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Rat gizzards. They smell bad and taste worse, but that's the best the desert has to offer.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: He certainly was not a popular fellow when they planted him.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Must of got a little too frisky with the Pharaoh's daughter.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Did you see that!? Grasshoppers! Billions of grasshoppers!

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: That's one of the plagues, right? The grasshopper plague!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Who's here!?

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: The guy! The Priest! THE MUMMY!

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: That looked rather painful.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Ya know, ever since I met you, my luck has been for crap.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Yes, I know, I do that to people.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Damn-it! That's two down and only two to go.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: And then he'll be coming after Evy.
